text: what's up outliers quick GameStop video cuz I didn't talk about it yesterday in the Market Outlook so I want to level set on the week as it stands out ahead and just keeping it a buck I don't see a whole lot right now it still seems fairly quiet in here we had a really interesting gme live stream we do this 00 P p.m. Pacific time and the last one we took some time digging into a little bit of game stops older transaction and one of the things that we did notice that was kind of interesting is that if we go into the dark pool feed to just see what kind of transactions are happening and different sizes we filter this by 5,000 shares again this is specifically for shares I'm going to filter by GameStop and we can see that there have been a a bit of a run of these 5,000 share blocks and it's been ebbing and flowing now one of the Curiosities we had during the live stream was hey what did this look like before the cat came back in May so what we did was actually go back and take a look at essentially what transactions took place through this entire period at that block level and we can see if we go all the way back we can see a bunch of them in in late may but if we filter this down and we're like okay what does

text: a look at essentially what transactions took place through this entire period at that block level and we can see if we go all the way back we can see a bunch of them in in late may but if we filter this down and we're like okay what does it look like the very beginning of May I think he came back on the 12th if I'm not mistaken so if we take like 1 to 10 May nothing and then if we go to April out of curiosity and take a look nothing but then if we go 13 to 24 we see them really starting to pick up a little bit later right so if you take a look at 21 22 so what this tells me is a lot of these transactions actually got kicked off by a lot of the movement that we saw and I don't necessarily think that the 5,000 block trades mean a whole lot I know a lot of people are generally um assigning that to Roaring Kitty is you know kind of like a calling card sort of thing but I I think it's a little misplaced and the reason is because we saw him move 5,000 block lots of options and that's for a very specific reason 5,000 Lots in options is a much bigger position than 5,000 shares 5,000 shares is actually quite small on a comparative basis and just in terms of the market liquidity it's completely

text: is because we saw him move 5,000 block lots of options and that's for a very specific reason 5,000 Lots in options is a much bigger position than 5,000 shares 5,000 shares is actually quite small on a comparative basis and just in terms of the market liquidity it's completely different so I think some people are maybe mistakenly associating the 5,000 the 5,000 lot options trades that he was making and then we see these dark pool trades hitting at 5,000 blocks thinking oh maybe it's him and I get why everybody's curious I'm curious to know what he's doing how could you not be it's literally this is literally like one of the most interesting stock market stories that I've ever come across my 17 years doing this it's fascinating but again my job I see as a Trader is always to try to look at things as objectively as possible and like nobody really has any sort of you know ownership over 5,000 especially when it comes to shares it's a nice round number and it doesn't really jump out at me as any one single entity and again like we can go back through a bunch of different time frames and see that this has been going on primarily since we started seeing the movement in the beginning miday into June so I thought that was generally interesting going through that exercise this past weekend we actually didn't finish we have to go through a part
